intro: Palicourea tatei, commonly known as the Mexican moonflower, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night, attracting nocturnal pollinators such as moths. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a glossy surface. Palicourea tatei is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
